column5: Well, well, well.  It's been about a week since my last report and it's about time to fill you all in on my past week's smorgasbord of fishing tales.  Monday  Was working a night shift today, which is not normal for me, however, I'll take a blessing when given one.  Kelli and I got out to Simcoe this morning in search of some monster smallies.  Hit up some favourite spots and saw lots of big fish, but they were spooky.  I lost about a 3 pounder on a jerkbait, caught lots of dinks on tubes.  Kelli caught lots on a tube and broke off a big girl on the hook set, dang 6 pound test!   Kelli with a couple of her Simcoe smallies, dinks for the lakes standard, but a fun day out.  Wednesday  Had a club tournament on Cooch tonight, a 2pm - 7:30 pm "twilight" tourney.  Got off to a great start and had my limit in the boat in less than 10 minutes, including a 3 pounder.  Had a hard time upgrading, but we managed to come in with 20.10 pounds (8 fish limit .... 4 fish each), including a 4.05 pounder.  We placed 2nd!  I was expecting better weight but a few of my key spots just did not produce.  Pics are on another camera, will post thme when i get them.  Thursday  My younger cousing Brent is a part of the Junior Bassmasters program, and recently won their first tourney of the year on Sparrow Lake and even won big fish with a 3.75 largie.   Brent with his fish from Sparrow   Anyways, with an upcoming tournament, I had to get him out to pre-fish, and give him some spots and tips.  He did very well, landing more than a limits worth of fish, and not losing any!!  Wish him the best of luck this weekend!!   Nice bucket to start the day   Another nice cruiser.   Nice smallie off our secret shoal.  Friday  After a LONG LONG drive following a 5am shift at Bass Pro, we arrived at Lake Nipissing.  I was way too tired to get out that evening but we sat on the dock to shoot the poop, and do a little fishin.  Tyler landed a nice little drum to start off the weekend.     Saturday  Saturday was a tough day.  We started off going for walleye and only came up with some small perch, so we went to my strength.  Bass Fishing!  We fished flukes in shallow water and missed a few nice smalljaws, and came up with some little pike.  As the evening went on, we got onto a nice topwater bite and started puttin some nice smallies in the boat.          Sunday  Sunday was HOT HOT HOT.  The girls satyed at the cabin and drank daquiries to keep cool, we braved it and went searching.  Got onto a good spinnerbait bite and landed some nice smallies in the 2-3 pound range.    Went back out in the evening for that topwater bite and it was on again, even rewarding us with some topwater pike action.          Great Week, hopefully this one will be just as good, if I can afford it!
Nice fish!! WTG!!
Nice work!!!
very nice report, thanks for  sharing. That drum is actually a white bass.
white bass eh?  I was wondering that.  It seemed like an odd place for drum, but having little experience with both, I had to throw out a guess, haha Thanks for the correction.

Nicely done...What kills me is that I was on the same dock, staying at the same place and my son and I didn't see a pike over 4 days. I was also telling Ken that I have problems catching bass at his place, yet you show up and clean up. That being said, my son and I focused on pickeral and caught limits every day. Just goes to show, I guess, that confidence in a certain species or technique leads to fish. Your report gives me hope next time I'm up. Andy
great report man!
great report
Great report Steve, some nice fish and it seems your younger bro is no slouch himself.... BUT,  it appears as though you're a wimp  .
Now that's about as close to a perfect week as I can think of (all but the 5am shift at least).  Thanks for the report
wtg looked like a blast nice fish

haha solo.  i am definitely a wimp, im a fatty and i like my sleep haha.  Andy, let me know when you're headed up next, I'll give you some pike spots, you give me some walleye spots.  Best of both worlds.

Well done steve!!!!!!! hey it sure looks like a whole bunch of happy fishermen .  ....great report & pics,you guys sure caught alot of nice smallies & largies,and pike to boot,a great fishing trip....cheers
Great Report. I know that weedline on Nipissing and I clean house there!
Awesome... Looks like you had a great week!
Thanks guys, I had fun for sure, back out at the end of the week.  Of course it will be followed by a report.
Looks like a great week!!  Thanks for sharing  dk
Great thread and super pics as well. Thanks for sharing, Steve.
Oh to be a student and have the summer off to do all that GREAT FISHING. Great report Steve. TFS
Great report and great pics.... I love when the ladies consume their time with booze. They tend to leave you alone.. LOL!
I dont have the summer off misfish, I work full time, but i strategically arranged a 5am - 2pm shift to have my afternoons and weekends off.  Pretty brilliant if i do say so myself.
